akas: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince World-wide (English title)
El Príncipe del Café World-wide (Spanish title)
Cafetería "El Príncipe" Sucursal No.1 World-wide (Spanish title) (alternative title)
akas from release info: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince World-wide (English title)
El Príncipe del Café World-wide (Spanish title)
Cafetería "El Príncipe" Sucursal No.1 World-wide (Spanish title) (alternative title)

1.title: First Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

1.plot: As a tomboy struggles through multiple jobs that don't quite make ends meet, a wealthy matriarch plans to change her ungrounded 29-year-old spoiled grandson.

2.title: Second Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

2.plot: Choi Han-kyul, thinking of Go Eun-chan as a girlish-looking boy, hires "him" to play his boyfriend to scare off his Grandmother's matchmaking efforts.

3.title: Third Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

3.plot: With Eun-chan's urging, Han-kyul agrees to run his grandmother's coffee shop but only by hiring adorable guys to work it.

4.title: Fourth Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

4.plot: The day of the grand opening arrives, making the future look rosy for the little coffee shop, but reality sinks in on the second day.

5.title: Fifth Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

5.plot: With business slow, Hong leads the group out on a team-building excursion.

6.title: Sixth Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

6.plot: As it becomes recognizable - not only to himself - that he is developing a personal interest in Eun-chan, Han-kyul devises a simple way to confirm his sexual orientation.

7.title: Seventh Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

7.plot: Fed up with Han-kyul's uneven treatment of her, Eun-chan quits the coffee shop, but both of them wonder how to return to how things were.

8.title: Eighth Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

8.plot: While Han-kyul becomes melancholy over news of his grandmother's terminal condition, he seeks professional advice on what to do about his taboo feelings for Eun-chan.

9.title: Ninth Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

9.plot: Eun-chan and Han-kyul enjoy their new brother-brother relationship but, in time, Han-kyul knows it's not enough and that he can't accept a relationship with a guy.

10.title: Tenth Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

10.plot: As relationships remain strained between Han-sung and Yoo-joo and between Han-kyul and Eun-chan, the coffee shop puts on its musical night.

11.title: Eleventh Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

11.plot: Han-kyul finally learns of Eun-chan's true sexual identity, but worst of all, the most shaming, is learning it last among his closest peers.

12.title: Twelfth Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

12.plot: In the wake of emotional pain, a period of candor, apology and possible reconciliation settles in.

13.title: Thirteenth Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

13.plot: Han-kyul's grandmother finally breaks the silence over Han-kyul's true origin, Yoo-joo returns, and Ha-rim gets caught giving Eun-chan a lesson in sex education.

14.title: Fourteenth Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

14.plot: Eun-chan's androgynous looks don't go over well with Han-kyul's family, who further believe her responsible for Han-kyul's sudden decision not to go to New York.

15.title: Fifteenth Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

15.plot: As one older member of Han-kyul's family begins to warm up to Eun-chan, Han-kyul and Eun-chan butt heads over Eun-chan's repayment plan and engagement length issues.

16.title: Sixteenth Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

16.plot: Han-kyul's grandmother steps in just as a riff develops between Han-kyul and Eun-chan over the length of their engagement, affording Eun-chan a chance to study in Italy.

17.title: Final Cup

episode of.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince (TV Series 2007)

17.plot: Eun-chan's departure for two years of study in Italy saddens everyone, but her subsequent overseas success may alter plans for her return.

imdb.plot outline: Go Eun Chan is a young woman who supports her mother and sister. Her short hair, boyish clothes, and manner often lead to her being mistaken for a young man. Laboring under this false impression, wealthy Choi Han Kyul hires her to pretend to be his "gay lover," to scare away the blind dates his grandmother has set up. Later, Han Kyul is asked to prove himself by managing a rundown coffee shop. Eun Chan maintains her false male identity to become a "Coffee Prince" employee. The charade becomes increasingly difficult as she falls in love with her boss. Han Kyul is both surprised and confused by his romantic feelings towards the "boy."
imdb.title: The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince
plot: A tomboy, mistaken for a lad, maintains the deception for the sake of employment. The situation becomes complicated when her male boss begins to develop feelings for this "boy."::L. Hamre

Go Eun Chan is a young woman who supports her mother and sister. Her short hair, boyish clothes, and manner often lead to her being mistaken for a young man. Laboring under this false impression, wealthy Choi Han Kyul hires her to pretend to be his "gay lover," to scare away the blind dates his grandmother has set up. Later, Han Kyul is asked to prove himself by managing a rundown coffee shop. Eun Chan maintains her false male identity to become a "Coffee Prince" employee. The charade becomes increasingly difficult as she falls in love with her boss. Han Kyul is both surprised and confused by his romantic feelings towards the "boy."::L. Hamre
synopsis: A lively, big-hearted tomboy in Seoul named Go Eun Chan works several jobs to support her mother and sister. When Choi Han Kyul, handsome and irresponsible scion of a wealthy family, meets Go Eun Chan, he mistakes her for a young man, and she does not correct him. Han Kyul is resisting his grandmothers pressure to go into business and to marry. Although Han Kyul and Eun Chan get off on the wrong foot, Han Kyul hires her to pose as his gay lover, in order to scare off the young women with whom his grandmother tries to match him up. The grandmother threatens to stop Han Kyuls allowance unless he proves himself by turning around a failing coffee shop. Choi Han Kyul decides to hire only good-looking men in order to attract female customers. He hires Go Eun Chan, who now must keep her gender secret or lose her job. Meanwhile, beautiful and successful artist Han Yoo Joo returns to Seoul to reunite with her long-time lover Choi Han Sung, who is Han Kyuls cousin. Han Kyul has long carried a torch for Yoo Joo. When both Choi cousins begin to have feelings for Eun Chan, and she for them, things get complicated particularly for Han Kyul, who begins to question his sexual orientation.
